conclusion: Analyze the image to understand relationships between terminal voltage U, current I, internal resistance of battery, and resistance R.
Graph shows voltage U on vertical axis and current I on horizontal axis with two lines: line a for battery's U-I relationship under specific light intensity, line b for resistance R.
Graph includes points where lines intersect.
Line a represents battery's U-I relationship under specific light intensity, indicating internal resistance is not constant.
Line b represents U-I relationship for resistance R.
Internal resistance r of battery can be found by determining slope of line a.
Intersection point of line a with current axis (U = 0) gives short-circuit current I0.
Intersection point of line a with voltage axis (I = 0) gives open-circuit voltage U0.
Internal resistance r is calculated using formula r = U0/I0.
Problem states internal resistance of silicon photocell is same as battery's internal resistance at this light intensity.
Internal resistance of silicon photocell is r = U0/I0.
